review: I have been very happy with the Fire TV.  The unit is extremely quick and responsive and has a huge selection of applications.  The controller is simple to use yet very effective for navigating.  Prime content is very easy to access.  Netflix works great.  HBO Go also works great.  Searching is easy.  For streaming media over the internet from subscription services this unit works fantastically.  If you are only buying this as a black box to stream subscription services over the internet to your TV then this is a 5 star unit.However, if you expect it to replace using something like a gaming console there are some limitations that you should be aware of before you purchase the Fire TV box.  There are other streaming media boxes that don't have these limitations, so be sure that you can live without these features before you choose the Amazon Fire TV:One limitation is that you may also not stream any local media from your network to the Fire TV without installing apps both on the Fire TV and your computer.  I use an application called Plex to stream from my computer to my Fire TV unit.  This works very well but it is disappointing that the Fire TV cannot do this on its own.Another limitation which bothers me much more than the local network streaming is the useless USB port.  The unit has a USB port on the side but it will not connect to an external hard drive or flash drive to play media off it like you would an Xbox or a Playstation.  This is simply not possible on the Fire TV at this time.  I can understand this on the Fire TV stick obviously, but this review is for the larger box which should come with the capability to play files.  Other streaming media players and all gaming consoles have the ability to play local files through the USB port so it is quite disappointing that Amazon left this feature out.I replaced an old Sony streaming media player with the Fire TV when my girlfriend moved out and took it with her.  This unit was slightly disappointing because even that cheap Sony streamer could play files over USB hard drives/flash drives and for whatever reason Amazon did not include this feature.  I can live without the network media streaming since Plex is a decent workaround but because of Amazon not including these features natively I am giving the unit 4 stars.

review: With the newest firmware update, you have the ability to now store apps on a USB drive.  I am using a Startech 2.5 USB/eSATA enclosure that has a 300 gb Hard drive in it.  That enclosure does require external power for it.  I have also tried a Crucial 64 gb SSD drive with the Fire TV box, and had no problems with using it.I would say that this is the best improvement ever with the Fire TV.  Especially with the fact that a lot of game apps can be around 5 gb.  Out of the box, the Fire TV uses around 3 gb of storage space.
